commit_message:
Broadcast policy sync to PEs on datasource create

This way the PEs will initialize the datasource schema and allow
rule creation using named arguments. Applies to both the single PE
distributed case as well as the replicated PE case.

Task previously kept as TODO.

Change-Id: I31137229ad72315549a9a1dc3655cc9a5aabe890

commit_message:
Replace file() with open() for Python 3 compatibility

The built-in named 'file' has been removed since Python 3.0 [1]
This patch replaces it by 'open' which is the same under Python 2 and 3.

[1] https://docs.python.org/release/3.0/whatsnew/3.0.html#builtins

Change-Id: I44d1625f44d46d1a7e9ee9109544bd5bec97c674

subject: re-enable ironic in congress gate
messages:
[{'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-02-07 04:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-02-07 04:58:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-02-07 05:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-02-07 07:08:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Still experiencing the same issue as seen before: No flavor with a name or ID of 'baremetal' exists.
http://logs.openstack.org/42/541542/2/check/congress-devstack-api-mysql/ec1e4ce/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2018-02-07_06_18_33_491

Need to figure out what special thing ironic gate is doing to get through devstack setup."}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-02-07 07:08:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-02-13 01:59:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-02-13 05:17:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-02-13 06:10:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thanks Anusha.

In case the change you just made doesn't solve the issue, here's what I've been looking at to fix the gate setup: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2016-07-20.log.html#t2016-07-20T14:13:31

It seems like a local.conf flag needs to be set, but instead of setting that manually in run.yaml, I'm trying to figure out how ironic gate job does it without an explicit setting. I was thinking maybe it was set by ironic-lib.

http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=IRONIC_BAREMETAL_BASIC_OPS&i=nope&files=&repos="}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-02-13 06:10:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Giving you everything I know so far in case you want/need to continue investigating.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-02-13 06:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Eric, looks like ironic is enabled now successfully'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-02-13 19:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Ah perfect. Let me re-enable the temporarily disabled jobs and then we can merge it.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-02-13 19:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-02-13 19:49:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-02-14 01:30:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Ok the export DEVSTACK_GATE_VIRT_DRIVER=ironic seems to be causing this with Nova.
http://logs.openstack.org/42/541542/6/check/congress-devstack-api-mysql/65ab92b/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=ERROR

Maybe ironic takes up the only host available and so nova can't create any more servers. Also it seems we can't mix virtualization drivers, so using ironic may prevent us from creating normal virtual machines for tests that involve virtualized networking.
Maybe ironic can't be in the same gate job. Still investigating how to proceed."}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2020-05-28 16:18:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Project retirement'}]

It was previously disabled because ironic devstack was failing
in gate.

Release-team: this is a testing-only change

The Monasca Alarm Datasource enables to receive alarms using the
push method in Congress to respond to conditions set as alarms
in Monasca.
Alarms are set out of band in Monasca and the Monasca Alarm
datasource processes and stores them into a table.

Change-Id: I2f74f20ca64f842c3f6dc5be5c33572c1b4aebc9
Co-Authored-By: Jonathan Leonard <jonathan@mustwin.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Monasca Alarm Datasource

The Monasca Alarm Datasource enables to receive alarms using the
push method in Congress to respond to conditions set as alarms
in Monasca.
Alarms are set out of band in Monasca and the Monasca Alarm
datasource processes and stores them into a table.

Change-Id: I2f74f20ca64f842c3f6dc5be5c33572c1b4aebc9
Co-Authored-By: Jonathan Leonard <jonathan@mustwin.com>

Hi Ruben, Thanks for the patch. Code looks great :)
Few comments inline. And also could you add tempest tests also, so that its easy to make sure everything works fine. I can definitely help you in adding tempest tests if you need. Eg tests look like https://github.com/openstack/congress/tree/master/congress_tempest_tests/tests/scenario/congress_datasources , README on how to run the tests https://github.com/openstack/congress/blob/master/congress_tempest_tests/tests/README.rst'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-04-08 01:53:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-16 11:29:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

commit_message:
Add missing SYSLOG_FACILITY to JournalHandler

Without SYSLOG_FACILITY log messages from journald forwards the message
to kern.log. This seems to be default behaviour as it treats the message
as kernel message.

This option provides a proper facility to the log message and kern.log
will not be filled up anymore.

Cherry-picked from commit 5b12e66f6283962d96884e4aa3fa7db7d4e062fa
Change-Id: I62a32ed46a400b62ead8c1e6e64acee658e2a769
Closes-Bug: #1871840

[{'created': '2020-04-21 21:32:27.000000000', 'message': 'Retire the Congress Dashboard project

Recently the TC has worked on determining the criteria for when an
OpenStack project should be retired.  When there was not a PTL nominee
for the Congress project, that triggered the TC to review the project
health per [1], and the TC has determined [2] that development work on
the project has ceased.  This decision was announced in the
openstack-discuss mailing list in April 2020 [3].

This commit retires the repository per the process for governance
removal in the Victoria cycle as specified in the Mandatory Repository
Retirement resolution [4] and detailed in the infra manual [5].

Should interest in developing Congress as part of OpenStack revive,
please revert this commit to have the project rejoin the list of active
projects.

The community wishes to express our thanks and appreciation to all of
those who have contributed to the Congress project over the years.

commit_message:
Retire the Congress Dashboard project

Recently the TC has worked on determining the criteria for when an
OpenStack project should be retired.  When there was not a PTL nominee
for the Congress project, that triggered the TC to review the project
health per [1], and the TC has determined [2] that development work on
the project has ceased.  This decision was announced in the
openstack-discuss mailing list in April 2020 [3].

This commit retires the repository per the process for governance
removal in the Victoria cycle as specified in the Mandatory Repository
Retirement resolution [4] and detailed in the infra manual [5].

Should interest in developing Congress as part of OpenStack revive,
please revert this commit to have the project rejoin the list of active
projects.

The community wishes to express our thanks and appreciation to all of
those who have contributed to the Congress project over the years.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/dropping-projects.html
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-tc/latest.log.html#t2020-04-20T15:36:59
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014292.html
[4] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20190711-mandatory-repository-retirement.html
[5] https://docs.opendev.org/opendev/infra-manual/latest/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

Change-Id: I8026809e82c6aff8b64932a931229a08c6360629

[{'created': '2020-04-23 09:43:29.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If990db865cd579cecc0cdb6d0c075112a55fa1b6
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If990db865cd579cecc0cdb6d0c075112a55fa1b6

commit_message:
Remove use of deprecated config options for volume API selection

Tempest has moved the Volume APIs testing to v3 as default and can be run
under v2 API via catalog_type.
- https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:volume-default-testing-v3+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

Below config options were deprecated since Rocky and now Tempest is going
to remove those (Needed-By patch):
    * ``CONF.volume-feature-enabled.api_v2``
    * ``CONF.volume-feature-enabled.api_v3``

Change-Id: I1ab737801b13f0c7a2e079ca0a1b43831ece1742
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698754/

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I634d8ebfd63cff4faad3c548d53732561c956d1f
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Remove column reference in vitrage driver test rule

The creation of rule with column reference needs to wait for datasource
table schema to propagate, leading to occassional time-out errors.
Because the use of column reference is unnecessary for these tests,
replace with rule without column reference.

Change-Id: I3da9f40aaaa3c2dc210b14d0f775951302f5565d

Not sure if its causing gate failure everytime at neutron ports test. But its definitely a potential.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2019-01-22 05:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Wow great catch!

Did you see in the logs anywhere the particular response status from neutron that causes the failure?

We could add that particular status (N/A?) to here [1] to fix the issue.

https://github.com/openstack/congress/blob/master/congress/datasources/neutronv2_driver.py#L36'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2019-01-22 05:55:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Actually, didn't find corresponding log that's why kept [TEST] tag because I was not sure if this is causing error on gate.
I have done step wise debugging on local env to find it.

Yes adding N/A will do. But not sure if that is valid thing. because in neutron api-ref[1] there are 3 status only.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/?expanded=list-floating-ips-detail#floating-ips-floatingips"}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2019-01-22 19:01:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I see. If the actual API response differs from the api-ref, would you mind filing a bug on neutron documenting that? Then they can decide whether to change the api-ref (probably) or the API.

Also just to check my understanding:

I understand the issue that if neutron says N/A and congress says OTHER, then this check fails:
https://github.com/openstack/congress-tempest-plugin/blob/master/congress_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/congress_datasources/test_neutronv2.py#L131

But I don't quite understand the rest of the commit message about the status changing after being attached. Since the data is fetched each time the check is retried, I don't quite understand why changes after attachment would break the test."}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2019-01-25 06:25:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2019-01-25 18:58:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2019-01-29 19:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2019-01-29 19:00:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Added a FIXME in comment and merging.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2019-01-29 19:25:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Holding off for a bit while investigating why similar error still occurs even with this patch in place.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2019-01-29 23:54:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review -Workflow

The dependent patch experienced the same failure even after this patch.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/621974/

So it seems the N/A vs OTHER issue isn't the problem or isn't the only problem.

I think I may have found a different cause and submitted another patch to address that: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633813/

Maybe we should merge that one first, and see whether that stops the check job failure."}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2019-01-30 00:53:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2019-01-30 00:58:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yes, Eric. Seems like missing something. That's why kept a dependent patch and rechecks."}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2019-01-31 03:18:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

On hold to discuss multiple approaches to fix it.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2020-05-28 16:08:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Project retirement'}]

[{'created': '2019-01-18 01:46:14.000000000', 'message': "[TEST]Gate fix for error randomly generating at neutron-port table

Gate has been randomly failing around neutron ports table test [1][2].
Which is probably because status of floating ip network changes after
being attached.

So there must be seperate test for testing neutronv2.floating_ips table
with the neutron floating_ips api's.

This commit simply skips comparing data around floating_ip row in ports
table.
Additional info - Congress returns status OTHER even if neutron is
returning port status - N/A [3]. (Which is probably extreme case because
we are using port-list not floating-ips-list for floating ip case)

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/73/630173/3/check/congress-devstack-api-mysql/8855542/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-11_13_08_47_155097
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/74/621974/2/gate/congress-devstack-py35-api-mysql/c787ac7/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-16_03_19_30_857691

Change-Id: Ie46117be7bf6c8dac594db341dcd33e042c90f7a

commit_message:
Gate fix for error randomly generating at neutron-port table

Gate has been randomly failing around neutron ports table test [1][2].
This is probably because status of floating ip network which is 'N/A'
until it is attached, which causes ambiguity in gate. As any state
other then 'ACTIVE', 'DOWN', 'BUILD', 'ERROR' will be converted to
'OTHER' in congress neutronv2 driver[3]. Hence when its N/A test fails.

So there must be seperate test for testing neutronv2.floating_ips table
with the neutron floating_ips api's.

This commit simply skips comparing data around floating_ip row in ports
table.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/73/630173/3/check/congress-devstack-api-mysql/8855542/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-11_13_08_47_155097
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/74/621974/2/gate/congress-devstack-py35-api-mysql/c787ac7/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-16_03_19_30_857691
[3] https://github.com/openstack/congress/blob/master/congress/datasources/neutronv2_driver.py#L40

Change-Id: Ie46117be7bf6c8dac594db341dcd33e042c90f7a

commit_message:
Set default tempest_test_timeout for ironic-base

The configuration of this job is shared between all jobs
that have `parent: ironic-base` so we don't need to set
timeouts in other jobs.

Change-Id: I49f8d7c4a8d33d38f430a6325a58e1a0af8411b1

commit_message:

commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Change-Id: I8e6b9bb7f25fb722e2d78a781a03b48d9b658a47

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I435d32bf034040325128f2b5275d907062d63351
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Remove six

Six is a python 2 and 3 compatibility library, remove it since openstack
use python3

Add toggle for sensitive data within octavia

This change will allow deployers to expose sensitive data as needed.

Apparently, 15 seconds is easily exceeded in our CI. Raise to 2 mins
for a more conservative default (can be changed via ironic.conf)

Change-Id: Ic155943f234505a34cfea273fd00441a9a0942f5
'}, {'created': '2020-05-15 13:43:22.000000000', 'message': 'Raise the JSON RPC connection timeout to 2 minutes and disable retries

Apparently, 15 seconds is easily exceeded in our CI. Raise to 2 mins
for a more conservative default (can be changed via ironic.conf)

Retries can be risky since a running request may end up being retried
if it takes really long. Also with 2 retries it may take 6 minutes
to give up on a failed server, which will cause timeouts on the caller
side anyway. Remove retries, while keeping a way to add them.

Change-Id: Ic155943f234505a34cfea273fd00441a9a0942f5
'}]
commit_message:
Raise the JSON RPC connection timeout to 2 minutes and disable retries

Apparently, 15 seconds is easily exceeded in our CI. Raise to 2 mins
for a more conservative default (can be changed via ironic.conf)

Retries can be risky since a running request may end up being retried
if it takes really long. Also with 2 retries it may take 6 minutes
to give up on a failed server, which will cause timeouts on the caller
side anyway. Remove retries, while keeping a way to add them.

Change-Id: Ic155943f234505a34cfea273fd00441a9a0942f5

commit_message:
Remove support for CentOS 7 and Python 2

* Always use Python 3
* Drop code paths for CentOS 7
* Drop support for Yum
* Remove support for host NTP daemon, always use chrony
* Switch references from 'yum_install_epel' to 'dnf_install_epel'
* Remove overcloud host image workaround for tagged VLAN admin network
* Remove the kayobe.utils.yum_install function, which is unused

Change-Id: I368f6edafed9779658798fc342116b4c1b3ffd48
Story: 2006574
Task: 39481

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.
Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Icba2725bf805f7b1d0ef7bc43a511e226852c9ef

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support and docs

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, merge constraints
  into dependencies
- Enable warnings for doc build, fix all warnings
- Remove python2 requirements
- Cleanup conf.py

Change-Id: Idfd4714cb246aae1c06c92cfe8dc79ef07e506ad

[{'created': '2020-05-21 10:59:51.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org

before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I17b23e36c46cea86ee24fab71c0833558825ba92

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using

* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents

lead to some strange rendering.

during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I17b23e36c46cea86ee24fab71c0833558825ba92

these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org

during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

commit_message:
Configure SNMP on undercloud

Transfering to containerized deployment of undercloud we lost automated
configuration of SNMP for undercloud. Telemetry stack is now failing to
HW monitor this node.

Change-Id: I219e2a8a08bc9b47bd7110fadcb188ef703acfce

subject: Add override for Auditbeat socket dataset
messages: [{'account_id': 31004, 'date': '2020-05-26 10:33:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-05-26 17:14:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-05-28 15:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-26 10:33:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add override for Auditbeat socket dataset

When deployed to a container host, the socket dataset of the Auditbeat
system module can become very CPU-intensive, as it captures all socket
events from all containers, data which largely overlaps with data
collected using Packetbeat. This commit adds an override flag to allow
this dataset to be selectively disabled in the case that this CPU usage
becomes too high.

Change-Id: I595c6b909a83e6f49b1042dff29b38953768ef67
'}]
commit_message:
Add override for Auditbeat socket dataset

When deployed to a container host, the socket dataset of the Auditbeat
system module can become very CPU-intensive, as it captures all socket
events from all containers, data which largely overlaps with data
collected using Packetbeat. This commit adds an override flag to allow
this dataset to be selectively disabled in the case that this CPU usage
becomes too high.

Change-Id: I595c6b909a83e6f49b1042dff29b38953768ef67

[{'created': '2020-05-27 05:43:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix repo_cmd_after for cloudsig ussuri release

centos-release rpms and repos were removed after

commit_message:
Fix repo_cmd_after for cloudsig ussuri release

centos-release rpms and repos were removed after
setupping of repos which is wrong, this patch fixes
it.

Change-Id: I3d87a9d8f1e85c163437e53b2588672eb2020e70

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-16 11:06:21.000000000', 'message': "Force IPv4 DNS resolution for ping while testing IPv4 host

While testing new Cirros 0.5.1 withing our gates I found that
ping command, that is used for check IPv4 addresses, at first
time tries to resolve DNS AAAA records instead A. It costs
about 15 seconds.

Starting from Cirros 0.5.1 the command produced by InternalDNS Test [1] started to fail:
'ping -c1 -w1 -s56 leia'

For Cirros 0.4.0 the same command returned True.

For both cases ping tries first to resolv IPv6 address, then IPv4, even when
ping command is specified. For both cases tcpdump from instance looks like:

10:23:56.012171 IP 10.1.0.11.59861 > 8.8.8.8.53: 2+ AAAA? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:01.018773 IP 10.1.0.11.46119 > 8.8.8.8.53: 3+ AAAA? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:06.025143 IP 10.1.0.11.37590 > 8.8.8.8.53: 4+ AAAA? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:11.032282 IP 10.1.0.11.57269 > 8.8.8.8.53: 5+ A? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:11.033211 IP 8.8.8.8.53 > 10.1.0.11.57269: 5- 1/0/0 A 10.1.0.4 (82)

As we see the answer from Internal DNS is sent immediately after A? request is send.
Unfornutely for now the same ping for Cirros 0.5.1 fails.

We can workaround the problem by limit DNS resolution only for IPv4 hosts while
using ping command. For ping6 it will still use IPv6 resolutions.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/blob/3fcdb0689b542386632dbdbebe3b4b25fb779319/neutron_tempest_plugin/scenario/test_internal_dns.py#L79

Change-Id: I1c865770c8b58b0f080acb715baee4a9c92efd0c

10:24:01.018773 IP 10.1.0.11.46119 > 8.8.8.8.53: 3+ AAAA? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:06.025143 IP 10.1.0.11.37590 > 8.8.8.8.53: 4+ AAAA? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:11.032282 IP 10.1.0.11.57269 > 8.8.8.8.53: 5+ A? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:11.033211 IP 8.8.8.8.53 > 10.1.0.11.57269: 5- 1/0/0 A 10.1.0.4 (82)

As we see the answer from Internal DNS is sent immediately after A? request is send.
Unfornutely for now the same ping for Cirros 0.5.1 fails.

We can workaround the problem by limit DNS resolution only for IPv4 hosts while
using ping command. For ping6 it will still use IPv6 resolutions.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/blob/3fcdb0689b542386632dbdbebe3b4b25fb779319/neutron_tempest_plugin/scenario/test_internal_dns.py#L79

Change-Id: I1c865770c8b58b0f080acb715baee4a9c92efd0c
"}, {'created': '2020-03-17 09:58:18.000000000', 'message': "Change wait parameter for ping command

While testing new Cirros 0.5.1 withing our gates I found that
ping command, that is used for check IPv4 addresses, at first
time tries to resolve DNS AAAA records instead A. It costs
about 15 seconds.

Starting from Cirros 0.5.1 the command produced by InternalDNS Test [1] started to fail:
'ping -c1 -w1 -s56 leia'

For Cirros 0.4.0 the same command returned True.

For both cases ping tries first to resolv IPv6 address, then IPv4, even when
ping command is specified. For both cases tcpdump from instance looks like:

10:23:56.012171 IP 10.1.0.11.59861 > 8.8.8.8.53: 2+ AAAA? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:01.018773 IP 10.1.0.11.46119 > 8.8.8.8.53: 3+ AAAA? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:06.025143 IP 10.1.0.11.37590 > 8.8.8.8.53: 4+ AAAA? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:11.032282 IP 10.1.0.11.57269 > 8.8.8.8.53: 5+ A? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:11.033211 IP 8.8.8.8.53 > 10.1.0.11.57269: 5- 1/0/0 A 10.1.0.4 (82)

As we see the answer from Internal DNS is sent immediately after A? request is send.
Unfornutely for now the same ping for Cirros 0.5.1 fails.

We can workaround the problem by changing the '-w' ping parameter to '-W'.
From Cirros ping help page:
        -W SEC          Seconds to wait for the first response (default:10)
                        (after all -c CNT packets are sent)
        -w SEC          Seconds until ping exits (default:infinite)
                        (can exit earlier with -c CNT)

With that change the tests started to work.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/blob/3fcdb0689b542386632dbdbebe3b4b25fb779319/neutron_tempest_plugin/scenario/test_internal_dns.py#L79

Change-Id: I1c865770c8b58b0f080acb715baee4a9c92efd0c
"}]
commit_message:
Change wait parameter for ping command

While testing new Cirros 0.5.1 withing our gates I found that
ping command, that is used for check IPv4 addresses, at first
time tries to resolve DNS AAAA records instead A. It costs
about 15 seconds.

Starting from Cirros 0.5.1 the command produced by InternalDNS Test [1] started to fail:
'ping -c1 -w1 -s56 leia'

For Cirros 0.4.0 the same command returned True.

For both cases ping tries first to resolv IPv6 address, then IPv4, even when
ping command is specified. For both cases tcpdump from instance looks like:

10:23:56.012171 IP 10.1.0.11.59861 > 8.8.8.8.53: 2+ AAAA? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:01.018773 IP 10.1.0.11.46119 > 8.8.8.8.53: 3+ AAAA? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:06.025143 IP 10.1.0.11.37590 > 8.8.8.8.53: 4+ AAAA? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:11.032282 IP 10.1.0.11.57269 > 8.8.8.8.53: 5+ A? leia.openstackgate.local. (42)
10:24:11.033211 IP 8.8.8.8.53 > 10.1.0.11.57269: 5- 1/0/0 A 10.1.0.4 (82)

As we see the answer from Internal DNS is sent immediately after A? request is send.
Unfornutely for now the same ping for Cirros 0.5.1 fails.

We can workaround the problem by changing the '-w' ping parameter to '-W'.
From Cirros ping help page:
        -W SEC          Seconds to wait for the first response (default:10)
                        (after all -c CNT packets are sent)
        -w SEC          Seconds until ping exits (default:infinite)
                        (can exit earlier with -c CNT)

With that change the tests started to work.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/blob/3fcdb0689b542386632dbdbebe3b4b25fb779319/neutron_tempest_plugin/scenario/test_internal_dns.py#L79

Change-Id: I1c865770c8b58b0f080acb715baee4a9c92efd0c

As a result of d92e71c2 the sync util can fail because it tries to
look up the ovsdb connection from the mechanism_manager under 'ovn'
but the sync util registers under 'ovn-sync'.

Change-Id: I6998b08672761a501e427aab5d581064d9425dde
Closes-Bug: #1876752
(cherry picked from commit 18dd0d4e5503b280d34700cad7ea109001ae55b5)

commit_message:
Fix ovn-db-sync-util after removing l3 ovsdb connection

As a result of d92e71c2 the sync util can fail because it tries to
look up the ovsdb connection from the mechanism_manager under 'ovn'
but the sync util registers under 'ovn-sync'.

Change-Id: I6998b08672761a501e427aab5d581064d9425dde
Closes-Bug: #1876752
(cherry picked from commit 18dd0d4e5503b280d34700cad7ea109001ae55b5)

use python 3.x logic.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-14 09:37:50.000000000', 'message': "Use native sgabios.bin

In recent distrubtions, for example Ubuntu 20.04, the sgabios.bin
ROM is provided directly by qemu-system-data as an actual file
under /usr/share/qemu and it conflicts with the one provided by
sgabios.
We need to copy the one under /usr/share/misc only if the other
one is a symlink, meaning it's provided by sgabios.

Change-Id: Ib5f23dbd8839a0927418692054f4ed4abd76babc
"}, {'created': '2020-05-20 14:23:37.000000000', 'message': "Use native sgabios.bin

In recent distrubtions, for example Ubuntu 20.04, the sgabios.bin
ROM is provided directly by qemu-system-data as an actual file
under /usr/share/qemu and it conflicts with the one provided by
sgabios.
We need to copy the one under /usr/share/misc only if the other
one is a symlink, meaning it's provided by sgabios.

Change-Id: Ib5f23dbd8839a0927418692054f4ed4abd76babc
"}, {'created': '2020-05-25 09:53:55.000000000', 'message': 'Remove sgabios.bin workaround

The bug has been fixed since a while, also in recent distributions,
for example Ubuntu 20.04, the sgabios.bin ROM is provided directly
by qemu-system-data as an actual file under /usr/share/qemu and
it conflicts with the one provided by sgabios, so removing the
workaround is actually needed to prevent failures.

Change-Id: Ib5f23dbd8839a0927418692054f4ed4abd76babc
'}]
commit_message:
Remove sgabios.bin workaround

The bug has been fixed since a while, also in recent distributions,
for example Ubuntu 20.04, the sgabios.bin ROM is provided directly
by qemu-system-data as an actual file under /usr/share/qemu and
it conflicts with the one provided by sgabios, so removing the
workaround is actually needed to prevent failures.

Change-Id: Ib5f23dbd8839a0927418692054f4ed4abd76babc

bindings to use ensure_package. Right now we are

(cherry picked from commit c0d0059afe8583a1e800ed7be16d2f738da792cd)

commit_message:
Consolidate python memcache bindings install

Consolidate all the installs of python memcache
bindings to use ensure_package. Right now we are
mixing the usage of ensure_resources on some places
which causes redecalaration issues.

Change-Id: I4951a7ef3addf5c113107d68ec697b617731bc06
(cherry picked from commit c0d0059afe8583a1e800ed7be16d2f738da792cd)

[{'created': '2020-01-27 10:11:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix check_floating_ip_status utility's output

The log part should print floating_ip's actuall status, not
the expected status. This will fix the bug when the floating_ip
is DOWN, however, the log states that the status is ACTIVE
as that's the wanted status.

Closes-Bug: 1788416
Change-Id: I83ca08ef77c243762210837bad800ce0c4d09fb5
"}, {'created': '2020-04-15 13:13:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix check_floating_ip_status utility's output

floating_ip variable contains old state of the floating ip - the state
which was correct before calling refresh method. After the refresh
the floating ip should be queried in order to obtain up to date state
to log out.

Closes-Bug: 1788416
Change-Id: I83ca08ef77c243762210837bad800ce0c4d09fb5
"}, {'created': '2020-05-01 14:26:21.000000000', 'message': "Fix check_floating_ip_status utility's output

floating_ip variable contains an old state of the floating ip - the state
which was correct before calling refresh method. In order to have the
latest floating ip data after calling refresh, the patch makes refresh
update the global floating_ip variable.

Closes-Bug: 1788416
Change-Id: I83ca08ef77c243762210837bad800ce0c4d09fb5

commit_message:
Fix check_floating_ip_status utility's output

floating_ip variable contains an old state of the floating ip - the state
which was correct before calling refresh method. In order to have the
latest floating ip data after calling refresh, the patch creates a class
as a wrapper around the refreshing ip's state and logging it.

Closes-Bug: 1788416
Change-Id: I83ca08ef77c243762210837bad800ce0c4d09fb5

commit_message:
Update scheduler instance info at confirm resize

When a resize is confirmed the instance does not belong to the source
compute any more. In the past the scheduler instance info is only
updated by the _sync_scheduler_instance_info periodic. This caused that
server boots with anti-affinity did not consider the source host.
But now at the end of the confirm_resize call the compute also updates
the scheduler about the move.

Conflicts:
  nova/compute/manager.py due to
  I933687891abef4878de09481937d576ce5899511 is a stable only patch
  nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py due to
  35ce77835bb271bad3c18eaf22146edac3a42ea0 is missing from stable/rocky

Change-Id: Ic50e72e289b56ac54720ad0b719ceeb32487b8c8
Closes-Bug: #1869050
(cherry picked from commit 738110db7492b1360f5f197e8ecafd69a3b141b4)
(cherry picked from commit e8b3927c92d29c74fd0c79b5a51b7a34e9d66236)
(cherry picked from commit e34b375a6161b15d92beba64fa281f40634ffeab)
(cherry picked from commit e1116ee3b776ec84e4ce7d6ac9346fa0d43269b5)

[{'created': '2020-05-27 21:15:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add more oslo::cache params to init

This adds two new parameters cache_backend
and manage_backend_package that is simply
proxy parameters that is passed down to
oslo::cache like all other modules.

This does not introduce a behavior change
since cache_backend defaults to
$::os_service_default we do not enforce
any new package installs even though
manage_backend_package is set to true
(like it was before since that is
oslo::cache default)

Updates the testing so we test for the
oslo::cache resource and not the functionality
that the resource itself has.

Change-Id: Ib6f6853dd34e83e757bee0382ee84141e3f4dbd8
(cherry picked from commit 2b44bcb990443f8818cfa4da4d558991716990e8)
'}]
commit_message:
Add more oslo::cache params to init

This adds two new parameters cache_backend
and manage_backend_package that is simply
proxy parameters that is passed down to
oslo::cache like all other modules.

This does not introduce a behavior change
since cache_backend defaults to
$::os_service_default we do not enforce
any new package installs even though
manage_backend_package is set to true
(like it was before since that is
oslo::cache default)

Updates the testing so we test for the
oslo::cache resource and not the functionality
that the resource itself has.

Change-Id: Ib6f6853dd34e83e757bee0382ee84141e3f4dbd8
(cherry picked from commit 2b44bcb990443f8818cfa4da4d558991716990e8)

commit_message:
Consolidate python memcache bindings install

Consolidate all the installs of python memcache
bindings to use ensure_package. Right now we are
mixing the usage of ensure_resources on some places
which causes redecalaration issues.

Since the resources need to be identical in order
to not raise redeclaration issues we cannot have
the horizon-package tag on the package.

Change-Id: I0a76cbe45774bbf6871c1803c056bc2f6b3b6c0d
(cherry picked from commit 3ec253827c10b81f61bf3b96cd85a50c2c264abc)

commit_message:
Consolidate python memcache bindings install

Consolidate all the installs of python memcache
bindings to use ensure_package. Right now we are
mixing the usage of ensure_resources on some places
which causes redecalaration issues.

Change-Id: I4951a7ef3addf5c113107d68ec697b617731bc06
(cherry picked from commit c0d0059afe8583a1e800ed7be16d2f738da792cd)

commit_message:
Fix pygments style

New theme of docs (Victoria+) respects pygments_style.
Since we starts using Victoria reqs while being on Ussuri,
this patch ensures proper rendering both in Ussuri and Victoria.

[{'created': '2020-03-23 10:50:25.000000000', 'message': 'ovsdb monitor: handle modified ports

This patch ensures that the ovsdb monitor propagates the events
received for modified ports.

We'll use a new list for the modified ports, which the neutron ovs
agent can handle.

In particular, this will cover the situation in which the ofport
changes. When using recent OVS Windows versions, VM ofports change
to -1 (invalid) when the VMs are shut down, receiving a valid
ofport when the VMs are powered back on (different than the initial
one). With this patch applied, "modify" events will be propagated
to the ovs agent, which will then update the OpenFlow rules.
The old rules are cleaned up by "update_stale_ofport_rules"
once the invalid ofport is detected.

Closes-Bug: #1843870
Co-authored-by: Alin Serdean <aserdean@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Conflicts:
      neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: I0c3a570cbb3fbb03b4224744b32e034e9e255f8e
(cherry picked from commit 451c21571f40ca83eb3189e5c924b03c0561f853)
'}]
commit_message:
ovsdb monitor: handle modified ports

This patch ensures that the ovsdb monitor propagates the events
received for modified ports.

We'll use a new list for the modified ports, which the neutron ovs
agent can handle.

In particular, this will cover the situation in which the ofport
changes. When using recent OVS Windows versions, VM ofports change
to -1 (invalid) when the VMs are shut down, receiving a valid
ofport when the VMs are powered back on (different than the initial
one). With this patch applied, "modify" events will be propagated
to the ovs agent, which will then update the OpenFlow rules.
The old rules are cleaned up by "update_stale_ofport_rules"
once the invalid ofport is detected.

Closes-Bug: #1843870
Co-authored-by: Alin Serdean <aserdean@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Conflicts:
      neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: I0c3a570cbb3fbb03b4224744b32e034e9e255f8e
(cherry picked from commit 451c21571f40ca83eb3189e5c924b03c0561f853)

[{'created': '2020-05-27 21:15:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add more oslo::cache params to init

This adds two new parameters cache_backend
and manage_backend_package that is simply
proxy parameters that is passed down to
oslo::cache like all other modules.

This does not introduce a behavior change
since cache_backend defaults to
$::os_service_default we do not enforce
any new package installs even though
manage_backend_package is set to true
(like it was before since that is
oslo::cache default)

Updates the testing so we test for the
oslo::cache resource and not the functionality
that the resource itself has.

Change-Id: Ib6f6853dd34e83e757bee0382ee84141e3f4dbd8
(cherry picked from commit 2b44bcb990443f8818cfa4da4d558991716990e8)
'}]
commit_message:
Add more oslo::cache params to init

This adds two new parameters cache_backend
and manage_backend_package that is simply
proxy parameters that is passed down to
oslo::cache like all other modules.

This does not introduce a behavior change
since cache_backend defaults to
$::os_service_default we do not enforce
any new package installs even though
manage_backend_package is set to true
(like it was before since that is
oslo::cache default)

Updates the testing so we test for the
oslo::cache resource and not the functionality
that the resource itself has.

Change-Id: Ib6f6853dd34e83e757bee0382ee84141e3f4dbd8
(cherry picked from commit 2b44bcb990443f8818cfa4da4d558991716990e8)

[{'created': '2020-05-26 10:58:14.000000000', 'message': "Add the noop management interface to the redfish hardware type

Apparently, we're hitting similar problems on some hardware that caused
us to add noop to ipmi. Maybe we should make it supported on all
hardware types, but right now it would break iLO. To reduce the scope
of this (hopefully backportable) patch, I'm limiting it to Redfish.

Change-Id: Ia44e5d83a7b2ce660be4822e7908dd75908ccbdd
Story: #2007713
Task: #39849
"}]
commit_message:
Add the noop management interface to the redfish hardware type

Apparently, we're hitting similar problems on some hardware that caused
us to add noop to ipmi. Maybe we should make it supported on all
hardware types, but right now it would break iLO. To reduce the scope
of this (hopefully backportable) patch, I'm limiting it to Redfish.

Change-Id: Ia44e5d83a7b2ce660be4822e7908dd75908ccbdd
Story: #2007713
Task: #39849

Hi Hervé, sorry if this has been asked before, but why not 2 different patches for each backend?'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-04-07 16:44:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 30:

> Hi Hervé, sorry if this has been asked before, but why not 2
 > different patches for each backend?


Indeed you are right, as discussed previously with Radoslaw I agree it could be split into 2 different patches but the rational behind the fact that we centralized all backends in one patch was to help us to test things in a WIP mode.

I merged backend functional tests together because the etcd3gw works out of the box without a lot of tricks, but we mostly facing issue with the memcache_pool backend functional tests and we wanted move further with that in a first time.

Now that Radoslaw fixed the zuul exection I will extract the memcached part to focus on it and allow to reduce the scope of the review.

I'll push a new patch set with only the functional tests settled and etcd3gw available.

I'll focus on the memcache part through a follow up patch."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-04-07 16:52:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 31.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-04-07 16:53:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-04-07 16:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-07 17:20:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

commit_message:
Adding functional tests

This project lack of functional tests, these changes aim to introduce them.

These changes activate functional tests for oslo.cache.

They introduced:
- related ci jobs
- splits tests into functional and unit
- bindep to manage backends server

Functional tests support the following backends for now:
- etcd3gw

Co-authored-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I604cb542ac25fd4bfac57ea607b447ac82404b7e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-29 15:13:17.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that the HAProxy certificate is updated

While doing research for this bugzilla[1] I found that since the
actual certificate PEM file is being bind mounted the mount is acting
as a hard link to the inode of the PEM rather than just a pointer to
it's location in the directory.  When the new file is copied over the
inode is updated but the container still maintains a link to the stale
inode.  This patch copies the contents of the certificate into the
container so that the HUP of HAProxy will reload the certificate.

[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1765839

Change-Id: Idf106c9ffa23ed00c497e1e5014e1b5718254320
Closes-Bug: 1871663
"}, {'created': '2020-04-29 15:26:05.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that the HAProxy certificate is updated

actual certificate PEM file is being bind mounted the mount is acting
as a hard link to the inode of the PEM rather than just a pointer to
it's location in the directory.  When the new file is copied over the
inode is updated but the container still maintains a link to the stale
inode.  This patch copies the contents of the certificate into the
container so that the HUP of HAProxy will reload the certificate.

[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1765839

Change-Id: Idf106c9ffa23ed00c497e1e5014e1b5718254320
Closes-Bug: 1871663
(cherry picked from commit 93c6bffb3b06c5978e5f3611e058b4afff08bdb9)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that the HAProxy certificate is updated

While doing research for this bugzilla[1] I found that since the
actual certificate PEM file is being bind mounted the mount is acting
as a hard link to the inode of the PEM rather than just a pointer to
it's location in the directory.  When the new file is copied over the
inode is updated but the container still maintains a link to the stale
inode.  This patch copies the contents of the certificate into the
container so that the HUP of HAProxy will reload the certificate.

[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1765839

Change-Id: Idf106c9ffa23ed00c497e1e5014e1b5718254320
Closes-Bug: 1871663
(cherry picked from commit 93c6bffb3b06c5978e5f3611e058b4afff08bdb9)

location updated.

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Change IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM default

Since IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE is default to dib,  we should have a
default value for IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM that is compatible.
Increasing to 3072 since is the default value we are using in our jobs.

Change-Id: I7b3dab51fa332bbd27a439fd38ebec74d94eb839

[{'created': '2020-05-26 23:39:29.000000000', 'message': "Update image import example in distributed multibackend storage

The example which this patch updates created the image using
image-create-via-import but on a multinode controller it's
not guaranteed that all the calls to do the import this way
will go to same controller and therefore that example was
error prone. This updated example avoids that problem.

Change-Id: I0a003e632658badb806255447211ac2dfb864fb6

Update the example to cover the case where the image may not be
on an existing web server.

commit_message:
Add debug output for libvirt ping checks

This patch adds some extra debug options to the ping check. It writes
the STDOUT of ping subprocess to a temporary file which can be logged in
the debug log level.

Change-Id: Ife9a1d409a8326fb9ff07b1b04508cd11f899d10
(cherry picked from commit 674cefe1e7b8a040f955a0edb5274dafe86975f7)

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-28 12:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2020-05-28 12:53:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nLGTM. Thanks.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-28 12:38:31.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ie46dee1f1b83b28fec4110c536577ef939186878
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ie46dee1f1b83b28fec4110c536577ef939186878

commit_message:
Drop legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-* jobs

This job has been failing on stable/ocata. It will take some work to get
things working right again. Since stable/ocata is in extended
maintenance phase, the easiest course of action at this point is to just
remove the job.

Change-Id: Ifbdc60824d613c453e5fb32a94765944d0cdc4b4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

We did manual tests and we also plan to extend CI to test using https as well.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-05-20 20:06:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Suggestion to simplify the code inline; see what you think.

The -1 is for this change not being tested; the changes you made to the test files set the config option to its default value, so there's no way to know if the config option actually does anything.  You don't need anything too elaborate, just something that shows that the code is in fact modifying the URL correctly.

Finally, Arkady is correct; even with a unit test added, all that tells us is that you're making https calls out to the backend; we don't know how the backend is reacting to them.  So I'm glad that you're planning to test with https in your CI.  We can trust your manual testing to get this patch merged, and you can follow up after the CI is testing https with a release note about this feature when we've got independent evidence that its working.  (I think you'll want a release note anyway, this is a nice feature to have.)"}, {'account_id': 28050, 'date': '2020-05-21 15:20:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 28050, 'date': '2020-05-21 15:25:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 28050, 'date': '2020-05-21 15:26:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
[SPDK] Add https protocol option to communicate with SPDK

Currently only http is available to communicate with SPDK
backend. This patch adds option to switch to https.

Signed-off-by: Maciej Szwed <maciej.szwed@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ice54adf6bb9456a53d10f6c5f0a1e2d0c8e58149

commit_message:
Remove unused Babel setup

We don't need the translation settings in setup.cfg anymore, remove
them - and remove babel.cfg.

Add Python 3.8 to setup.cfg.

Change-Id: Ia912d1d3ee2e2f95cbd56984a32d1153d758977c

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-26 06:16:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-05-28 09:40:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-05-28 12:40:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-26 06:16:17.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I3984c5b0a99f5dd1224ebd29b16ebbef14225f49
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I3984c5b0a99f5dd1224ebd29b16ebbef14225f49

While the primary purpose of the many recheck was to see when the fix for the Octopus radosgw packages had arrived in archives [0], some of the failures are due to other conditions that we should take a look at.

Example:

    Apr 10 07:27:32 juju-c23113-zaza-ec520271c4dc-6 systemd[1]: ceph-radosgw@rgw.juju-c23113-zaza-ec520271c4dc-6.service: Scheduled restart job, restart counter is at 5.
    Apr 10 07:27:32 juju-c23113-zaza-ec520271c4dc-6 systemd[1]: ceph-radosgw@rgw.juju-c23113-zaza-ec520271c4dc-6.service: Start request repeated too quickly.

This indicates that if it takes too long for the ceph-radosgw unit to retrieve keys from the ceph cluster it will eventually give up and never restart the radosgw service.

That would also be a source of intermittent failures.  We should solve this by keeping the service down until keys have been retrieved to then start it up.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-04-14 06:41:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-04-14 07:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2020-04-14 08:29:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-04-14 14:44:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Workflow-1

Last failure:

    2020-04-14 06:59:37 DEBUG osd-relation-changed Error ERANGE:  pg_num 4 size 3 would mean 762 total pgs, which exceeds max 750 (mon_max_pg_per_osd 250 * num_in_osds 3)
2020-04-14 06:59:37 ERROR juju-log osd:6: Command '['ceph', '--id', 'admin', 'osd', 'pool', 'create', 'default.rgw.buckets.index', '4']' returned non-zero exit status 34.

So even with the PG autoscaling division by zero bug fixed it appears we need to adjust the ceph-mon charms calculation when creating pools. I'll raise a new bug for it."}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-04-14 15:37:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-ceph-mon/+bug/1872748'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-05-28 04:52:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-05-28 05:55:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-05-28 07:30:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-05-28 07:31:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Determine default port based on presence of TLS configuration

Fix intermittent deployment failure with TLS.

Default to TLS in the functional test.

The call to ``configure_https`` in identity_changed is remains
from the time when Keystone provided certificates, remove it.

Hold service down until keys are rendered.

Change-Id: Ia16e6200520972c503102d80cda35e36daea82a2
Closes-Bug: #1868387

commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Change-Id: I39beb972383622d4c4a3b17cb9c3d30674bca5bc

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I9f7227ec5ed4d84efd36d87fec7f0536276fc151
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
zuul: Make barbican-simple-crypto-devstack-tempest a non-voting check job

The job itself appears very stable at present and would greatly improve
our coverage of features such as image signature verification, encrypted
volumes using an actual key manager etc.

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/builds?job_name=barbican-simple-crypto-devstack-tempest#

Change-Id: I73cc2252bd59a4de00deab9d9c522717d6842c46

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-13 02:40:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Ie343a8e748e899196ed543370efe7bf734127163
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Ie343a8e748e899196ed543370efe7bf734127163

Most OpenStack projects no longer support Python 3.5, which
currently leads to dependency issues.

commit_message:
Disable image sanity check

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/718946/ adds image sanity
check for build images which runs on overcloud full but
in build images role, all the images are built,
so disabling images sanity check and removing
tripleo_image_type: overcloud-full fix the issue.

Change-Id: Ia47b8fc3990e56653d28d2d467e6659db68fdae6
Signed-off-by: Bhagyashri Shewale <bshewale@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
as they are not actually used in tests (other than pep8).

more info: https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/blacklist.txt

Change-Id: I2a6251daea1a6264b06f83b9e21866f4bce8aa96

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-26 17:12:03.000000000', 'message': 'Delete segment RPs when network is deleted

When a network is deleted, only one Placement call per segment
is done to remove the associated (if existing) resource provider.

Before this patch, each time a subnet was deleted, the segment
resource provider was updated. When no subnets were present in the
related segment, the associated resource provider was deleted.

This optimization improves the network deletion time (see Launchpad
bug). E.g.: a network with two segments and ten subnets, the Neutron
server processing time dropped from 8.2 seconds to 4.4 seconds (note
that the poor performance was due to the modest testing environment).

Along with the segment RP optimization during the network deletion,
this patch also skips the router subnet update. Because all subnets
in the network are going to be deleted, there is no need to update
them during the network deletion process.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py

Change-Id: Ifd50027911a9ca3508e80e0de9a6cc45b67006cf
Closes-Bug: #1878916
(cherry picked from commit 7f40e626d6de5ec895343453b032b747c02e59f5)
(cherry picked from commit 2614637a697eeeafb0b9979ba2024bcd03658988)
'}]
commit_message:
Delete segment RPs when network is deleted

When a network is deleted, only one Placement call per segment
is done to remove the associated (if existing) resource provider.

Before this patch, each time a subnet was deleted, the segment
resource provider was updated. When no subnets were present in the
related segment, the associated resource provider was deleted.

This optimization improves the network deletion time (see Launchpad
bug). E.g.: a network with two segments and ten subnets, the Neutron
server processing time dropped from 8.2 seconds to 4.4 seconds (note
that the poor performance was due to the modest testing environment).

Along with the segment RP optimization during the network deletion,
this patch also skips the router subnet update. Because all subnets
in the network are going to be deleted, there is no need to update
them during the network deletion process.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py

Change-Id: Ifd50027911a9ca3508e80e0de9a6cc45b67006cf
Closes-Bug: #1878916
(cherry picked from commit 7f40e626d6de5ec895343453b032b747c02e59f5)
(cherry picked from commit 2614637a697eeeafb0b9979ba2024bcd03658988)

commit_message:
Removing comments that breaks overcloud_update_prepare.sh

The Jinja script for overcloud_update_prerpare was breaking
in case the rhsm condition is true, a comment was causing
a line break and the script ended with error:
/home/stack/overcloud_update_prepare.sh: line 31: -e: command not found

Change-Id: I16fe73c3dd2defd036d71cbe11ea71b6efc2c667

subject: Revert "dib-lint: use yamllint to parse YAML files"
messages: [{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-05-28 06:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-05-28 07:00:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+2 Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-05-28 07:00:26.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged by Ian Wienand'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-28 06:45:04.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "dib-lint: use yamllint to parse YAML files"

This reverts commit 6ee2995214ee5512c64244ce0ccc7fda639c2d36 and
e85c2a6f035a016f80de3d5aebc026f28dfb6bc1.

I missed that if you pip install and then run dib-lint, it's not going
to pick up the .yamllint file shipped here.  Thus it gives spurious
errors.

The reason for this was simply better duplicate key detection in yaml
files, which caused us problems with the kernel installs.  However, at
this point it seems just the old "does it load" test from pyyaml will
be enough.

Change-Id: I87a9fc9bb119cfeffad48fc0fa0df31f0181825d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "dib-lint: use yamllint to parse YAML files"

This reverts commit 6ee2995214ee5512c64244ce0ccc7fda639c2d36 and
e85c2a6f035a016f80de3d5aebc026f28dfb6bc1.

I missed that if you pip install and then run dib-lint, it's not going
to pick up the .yamllint file shipped here.  Thus it gives spurious
errors.

The reason for this was simply better duplicate key detection in yaml
files, which caused us problems with the kernel installs.  However, at
this point it seems just the old "does it load" test from pyyaml will
be enough.

Change-Id: I87a9fc9bb119cfeffad48fc0fa0df31f0181825d

commit_message:
Validation of VMDK upload completion

Validate the completion of VMDK upload in ImportVApp. Otherwise, an
incomplete upload is falsely marked as successful which results in
corrupted VM.

Change-Id: I0608afd31daf95b564d3fc32028401d4aa526055

A new Dell EMC VxFlexOS  config is added with
new parameters. Use that instead.
See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728720/

commit_message:
Allow to override cirros image

We may want to override cirros image for different jobs
and situations. The most appropriate way to do this is
via featureset_override since this is a tempest feature.

Change-Id: I4994cc95907458d44823e93c22adb5e40131b97f

Earlier octavia tests were skipped so job was green https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/c33163173dc10d099181df3338c6f63b38e2b409 and we removed that.

Now the existing tests defined in sc10-ovn is broken we are working with octavia team to get it fixed.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2020-05-26 10:19:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2020-05-26 12:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-05-27 06:24:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Port sc10 job to os_tempest

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/726752/ ports the fs062 to
os_tempest and c8 based job runs from ussuri onwards so
it is safe to port validate-tempest job var to os_tempest and
remove tempest_worker (validate-tempest) var.

Above review also overrides the sc10-ovn job so the job has
started passing with the tests defined in fs062 as current
tests in jobs are broken so keeping the job nv.

It ports:
* tempest_whitelist -> tempest_test_whitelist
* tempest_extra_config ->  tempest_tempestconf_profile_overrides

tempest_tempestconf_profile_overrides adds as a featureset
overrides as it will be used in zuul jobs.

Note: sc10-ovn job is still broken with failing tempest tests.

Change-Id: I6be42c07b196829b771637d4a2c2f0cb3ee4456c
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove explicit support for EOL Fedora versions and Debian Jessie

Fedora 30 has just reached end-of-life, anything older than that can
be safely dropped.

Debian Jessie reached general end-of-life in 2018 and its LTS ends
in June 2020.

Also update the docs.

Change-Id: Id2339d198d79459fb04990a4d39cedb273f61506

commit_message:
Remove octavia tempest tests from skiplist

This patch https://review.opendev.org/#/c/727739/ removed
the octavia tempest tests from master and train,
and it got missed during ussuri branching.

Here removed the octavia tempest tests from skiplist for ussuri.

Change-Id: Ib2659314e4b722e790ed7184460076c8b82cc34c
Signed-off-by: Bhagyashri Shewale <bshewale@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix a grammar error in explanatory notes

This patch changes "The default is rate is 50"
to "The default is rate is 50" at the 92 line
in cinder/volume/drivers/inspur/instorage/
instorage_common.py

Change-Id: I13d120f1611d6343e708e9d88926e9c4028e6479
Closes-Bug: #1880067

commit_message:
Add max-stacks-per-tenant config option

This configuration option allows operators to change the default of
how many stacks a project can have in parallel.

This key has been available since Mitaka:
https://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/config-reference/orchestration.html

Closes-Bug: #1871772
Change-Id: I4dc0008c1098a969d62ee4a8afe76de4bfb5c235

[{'created': '2020-05-26 19:50:29.000000000', 'message': "Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I929a573714e0ce8218e0820babc16f9862c4a36e
"}]
commit_message:
Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I929a573714e0ce8218e0820babc16f9862c4a36e

Currently supported releases for Fedora are
Fedora 31 and Fedora 32. More information in

commit_message:
Update devstack to support Fedora 32

Currently supported releases for Fedora are
Fedora 31 and Fedora 32. More information in
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/End_of_life.

This change updates stack.sh so we can Devstack
on Fedora 32 without setting the FORCE=yes env
variable.

Change-Id: I6226258a6f1bff2d1dae40325d2c18c5ee0c5ba6

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
as they are not actually used in tests (other than pep8).

more info: https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/blacklist.txt

Change-Id: I11982b20690d5af812522b70a8f8e81d529f84b4

commit_message:
Use correct space binding for live migration

Ensure that the 'migration' network space binding or the fallback
configuration option is passed to the nova-cloud-controller application
so that the correct IP address is SSH host scanned during setup of
live migration between hypervisors.

Change-Id: I6e20cd0b03f564ee9c110cf58fb0466f6a1f6c82
Closes-Bug: 1874235
(cherry picked from commit 8aa29cc75576aad8453196a6e2cccd283085e168)

subject: Stop duplicating Nova cells
messages: [{'account_id': 29344, 'date': '2020-05-28 07:39:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-05-28 08:24:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:\n\nIsn't Pike already EOL?"}, {'account_id': 29344, 'date': '2020-05-28 08:38:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-28 07:39:41.000000000', 'message': "Stop duplicating Nova cells

Check if a base Nova cell already exists before calling `nova-manage
cell_v2 create_cell`, which would otherwise create a duplicate cell when
the transport URL or database connection change.

If a base cell already exists but the connection values have changed, we
now call `nova-manage cell_v2 update_cell` instead. This is only
possible if a duplicate cell has not yet been created. If one already
exists, we print a warning inviting the operator to perform a manual
cleanup. We don't use a hard fail to avoid an abrupt change of behavior
if this is backported to stable branches.

Change-Id: I7841ce0cff08e315fd7761d84e1e681b1a00d43e
Closes-Bug: #1734872
(cherry picked from commit 19b8dbe460315c5da23c33aa57c967d75d7f2018)
(cherry picked from commit f6cfee3201d0067ee500dd507924038315ac6efd)
"}]
commit_message:
Stop duplicating Nova cells

Check if a base Nova cell already exists before calling `nova-manage
cell_v2 create_cell`, which would otherwise create a duplicate cell when
the transport URL or database connection change.

If a base cell already exists but the connection values have changed, we
now call `nova-manage cell_v2 update_cell` instead. This is only
possible if a duplicate cell has not yet been created. If one already
exists, we print a warning inviting the operator to perform a manual
cleanup. We don't use a hard fail to avoid an abrupt change of behavior
if this is backported to stable branches.

Change-Id: I7841ce0cff08e315fd7761d84e1e681b1a00d43e
Closes-Bug: #1734872
(cherry picked from commit 19b8dbe460315c5da23c33aa57c967d75d7f2018)
(cherry picked from commit f6cfee3201d0067ee500dd507924038315ac6efd)

commit_message:
Do not rotate CephX secrets

we do not want the CephX keys to rotate by default, some cannot
be changed at all after the cluster has been deployed

Change-Id: Iefe87eb869e248ea1e98d9ae34cdeeea57aa5426

'}, {'created': '2020-03-12 06:32:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix invalid test in cinder data migration script

The extend_start.sh script for cinder-api uses an incorrect test to
check if the MAX_NUMBER variable is set. This leads to a incorrect
cinder-manage command being run if this variable is not set, making the
database migration fail.

This change fixes the test to properly use the MAX_NUMBER variable.

Change-Id: Ie46da709db0de09a9cf641b3c154275282f213fc
Closes-Bug: #1866827
'}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid test in cinder data migration script

The extend_start.sh script for cinder-api uses an incorrect test to
check if the MAX_NUMBER variable is set. This leads to a incorrect
cinder-manage command being run if this variable is not set, making the
database migration fail.

This change fixes the test to properly use the MAX_NUMBER variable.

Change-Id: Ie46da709db0de09a9cf641b3c154275282f213fc
Closes-Bug: #1866827

commit_message:
Don't install python-dev on focal

Also, install yamllint in the dib env, as it's a requirement
of dib-lint now but is only in test-requirements for dib.

Change-Id: I083bca901ca51438099d1d3bbbd0076ac3d7da07

commit_message:
Add admin doc information about image cache resource accounting

This adds some details to the image cache page in the admin docs about
how image cache disk usage is (not) considered in the scheduler disk
space calculation. Workarounds and mitigation strategies are provided.

Conflicts:
  doc/source/admin/image-caching.rst due to
  829ccbe2bbc4e80e92baf7553401d7925d883732 and
  828e8047e5c8651ea757bda7922670889d5e8818 is not in stable/train.

Basically this patch is now a partial backport of
829ccbe2bbc4e80e92baf7553401d7925d883732 squashed into
57702ad4849a4ffc0c02df97269c8d7f44b57bae .

Change-Id: I7f40f167cea073a73cf249a9adfd73e1187c031b
Related-Bug: #1878024
(cherry picked from commit ab3fab03222a5e82ca96ed2a4e959ac7faa3f4fe)
(cherry picked from commit 57702ad4849a4ffc0c02df97269c8d7f44b57bae)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-28 05:49:27.000000000', 'message': "Require relation to nova-compute application

Without a relation to at least one nova-compute application a
cinder-ceph backend will not be functional as the libvirt
secrets will not have been created to allow access to the
ceph cluster from libvirt/qemu.

Add a simple context to check that the 'ceph-access' relation
is present.  This will result in a blocked status if the
relation is not detected - for example:

  Missing relations: nova-compute

Change-Id: Iedbf4aafc2348cbf6f14257417e86aa9aeb48a81
Closes-Bug: 1718051
"}]
commit_message:
Require relation to nova-compute application

Without a relation to at least one nova-compute application a
cinder-ceph backend will not be functional as the libvirt
secrets will not have been created to allow access to the
ceph cluster from libvirt/qemu.

Add a simple context to check that the 'ceph-access' relation
is present.  This will result in a blocked status if the
relation is not detected - for example:

  Missing relations: nova-compute

Change-Id: Iedbf4aafc2348cbf6f14257417e86aa9aeb48a81
Closes-Bug: 1718051
